questions.question: What property is used to adjust the space between text characters?

answers.a: font-style

questions.question: What is the line-height property primarily used for?

answers.a: to control the height of the space between two lines of content
answers.b: to control the height of the space between heading elements
answers.c: to control the height of the character size
answers.d: to control the width of the space between characters

questions.question: Which is NOT true about class selectors?

answers.a: Multiple classes can be used within the same element.
answers.b: The same class can be used multiple times per page.
answers.c: Class selectors with a leading period
answers.d: Classes can be used multiple times per page but not within the same element.

questions.question: How would you make the first letter of every paragraph on the page red?

answers.a: p::first-letter { color: red; }

questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid color value?

answers.a: color: #000

questions.question: When using position: abosolute, what will the element always be positioned relative to?

answers.a: the closest element with position: relative

questions.question: When using Flexbox, what property and value is used to display flex items in a column?

answers.a: flex-flow: column; or flex-direction: column

questions.question: Which of these properties should be used to align a global navigation bar which stays fixed at the top of the page?

answers.a: position

questions.question:
when will the color pink be applied to the anchor element, In the example below?

a:active {  color: pink; }

answers.a: The color of the link will display as pink after its been clicked or if the mouse is hovering over the link.
answers.b: The color of the link will display as pink on mouse hover.
answers.c: The color of the link will display as pink while the link is being clicked but before the mouse click is released.
answers.d: The color of the link will display as pink before it has been clicked.

questions.question: Which property would you used, To change the color of an SVG using CSS?

answers.a: Use background-fill to set the color inside the object and stroke or border to set the color of the border.
answers.b: The color cannot be changed with CSS.
answers.c: Use fill or background to set the color inside the object and stroke to set the color of the border.
answers.d: Use fill to set the color inside the object and stroke to set the color of the border.

questions.question: When using position: fixed, what will the element always be positioned relative to?

answers.a: the closest element with position: relative

questions.question: When using media queries, media types are used to target a device category. Which choice lists current valid media types?

answers.a: print, screen, aural

questions.question: What is the rem unit based on?

answers.a: The rem unit is relative to the font-size of the p element.
answers.b: You have to set the value for the rem unit by writing a declaration such as rem { font-size: 1 Spx; }
answers.c: The rem unit is relative to the font-size of the containing (parent) element.
answers.d: The rem unit is relative to the font-size of the root (html) element of the page.

questions.question: How would you give a block element rounded corners?

answers.a: corner-curve: 10px

questions.question: What is the difference between display:none and visibility:hidden?

answers.a: display:none hides the elements but maintains the space it previously occupied. visibility:hidden will hide the element from view and remove it from the normal flow of the document
answers.b: display:none hides the element from view and removes it from the normal flow of the document. visibility:hidden will hide the element but maintains the space it previously occupied.
answers.c: There is no difference; both will hide the element on the page

questions.question: Which would properly scale an element to be 50% smaller on hover?

answers.a: element:hover {transform: scale(50%);}

questions.question: What is not true about class selectors?

answers.a: Only one class value can be assigned to an element.
answers.b: An element can have multiple class value.
answers.c: Class selectors are marked with a leading period.
answers.d: More than one element can have the same class value.

questions.question: What is the difference between the margin and padding properties?

answers.a: Margin adds space around and inside of an element; padding adds space only inside of an element.
answers.b: Margin adds space around an element; padding adds apace inside of an element.
answers.c: Margin adds a line around an element, padding adds space inside of an element.
answers.d: Margin adds space inside of an element, padding adds space around an element.

questions.question: Which style places an element at a fixed location within its container?

answers.a: position: absolute;

questions.question: When would you use the @font-face method?

answers.a: to set the font size of the text
answers.b: to load custom fonts into a stylesheet
answers.c: to change the name of the font declared in the font-family
answers.d: to set the color of the text
